docs.title: Welcome to Universal Arena
docs.text: This site outlines the structure and references for Universal Arena. Add your own content as you grow the guide.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This guide summarizes core systems and links to the detailed reference pages for terms, keywords, and characters.

docs.title: How To Play
docs.text:
1. Build a deck with characters and their cards.
  2. Play cards each turn by spending Energy; build Ultimate Meter to unleash ultimates.
  3. Track Keywords and Conditions to maximize your combos.

docs.title: Characters
docs.text:
1. Copy docs/characters/template.md to docs/characters/<slug>.md.
  2. Prefer character artwork in docs/assets/characters/ and reference it with a relative URL (avoids broken external images).
  3. Add the page to mkdocs.yml under the Characters nav section.
  4. Add a card to docs/characters/index.md:
<a class="character-card" href="<slug>/" data-name="Name" data-version="Version" data-tags="tag1,tag2">
  <div class="character-card__title">Name</div>
  <div class="character-card__meta">Version: Version</div>
  <div class="character-card__tags">Tags: Tag 1, Tag 2</div>
  <p class="character-card__summary">One-line summary.</p>
</a>

docs.title: Keywords

<div class="ua-entry keyword-entry" id="keyword-<slug>">

docs.title: Linking keywords from other pages
docs.text:
Use the shared keyword link markup anywhere (character pages, rules pages, etc.). The guide.js script will rewrite it to the correct URL, even with instant navigation and a site_url base path.

<a class="ua-keyword-link" data-keyword="keyword-<slug>" href="#">Keyword Name</a>

docs.title: Adding a new filterable page
docs.text:
1. Use the shared filter UI:
<div class="ua-filter">
  <label class="ua-filter__label" for="my-filter">Filter</label>
  <input class="ua-filter__input" type="search" id="my-filter" placeholder="Type to filter..." autocomplete="off" spellcheck="false" />
</div>
  1. Add a small setupFilter(...) block in docs/javascripts/guide.js for your new id and item selector.

docs.title: Status Effects
docs.text:
This page explains what status effects are and how their values work.

Explanation

Status Effects are conditions that can be applied to units on either side of a battle through the use of passives, skills, ultimates, and even other status effects.

A status effect can use up to two values to function, which will be called "modes" here for clarity:

  • Zero-value mode: the value is always fixed at 1 and has no inherent effect on the status effect's strength.
  • Single-value mode: one value is typically called Count, Stack, or Value.
  • Double-value mode: two values (Potency + Count). Generally, Potency determines strength, while Count determines duration.

In single-value or double-value modes, if one or more of the values reach 0, the status effect is removed from the unit. Values are always consumed before they are gained or inflicted.

Status effects also come with a few attributes:

  • Base Value: the initial value on infliction if none is specified.
  • Max Value: the maximum value (default 99).

docs.title: Reference
docs.text:
Use the filter to quickly locate a mode, rule, or attribute.

Filter status effects

Zero-value mode

Fixed at 1. The value exists for consistency, not scaling.

Single-value mode

One value (often Count, Stack, or Value) defines the effect and/or duration.

Double-value mode

Two values: Potency (strength) and Count (duration).

Removal at 0

In single- and double-value modes, reaching 0 on any value removes the status effect.

Consumption order

Status effect values are always consumed before they are gained or inflicted.

Base Value and Max Value

Base Value is the default on infliction; Max Value caps growth (default 99).
